newsitem.title: CANADA: GOLF-DUNLAP GRABS EARLY LEAD AT CANADIAN OPEN.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-DUNLAP GRABS EARLY LEAD AT CANADIAN OPEN.

text.p: OAKVILLE, Ontario, Sept 5 (Reuter) Scott Dunlap fired a 8-under-par 64 on Thursday to grab a two-stroke lead after the first round of the $1.5 million Canadian Open at the Glen Abbey Golf Club.
Dunlap, who carded six birdies in a bogey-free round, has never won a tournament, although he had his best finish here last year when he finished eighth.
Jesper Parnevik, who spent most of day in the lead, shot a 6-under-par 66, with eight golfers three strokes back at 5-under.
"I was looking forward to coming back here", Dunlap said. "My game was starting to feel good and I was playing a place I knew well. So I started with the best attitude I've had in a long time."

The 33-year-old Dunlap birdied four holes on the front nine, including consecutive birdies on the fifth and sixth. He missed a chance at eagle on the par-5 fifth when he two-putted for biride. He then used a 6-iron to get within five feet of the hole on the sixth.
Dunlap added a birdie on eight and again on 13 before carding an eagle on the par-5 16th. He closed out the round with a birdie on the 18th.
"Everything that could go right today did," Dunlap said. "Whenever you get going good, you remember those previous good rounds and use them to keep confidence going and get yourself into the house."
Parnevik also shot a bogey-free round with three birdies on the front nine, including one at the par-3 seventh hole when his 7-iron tee shot left him five feet from the cup.
The 31-year-old Parnevik, who finished tied for third at the Greater Milwaukee Open last week, added three more birdies on the back nine.

"I felt bad on the range," said Parnevik. "I couldn't loosen up. I hit a terrible drive on the first hole and had to 5-iron in. Last week was a tough one. After two-putting 17, all I was thinking was birdie on 18."
Justin Leonard, Ernie Els, Billy Mayfair, Arden Knoll, Frank Lickliter, Andrew Magee, Guy Hill and Carl Paulson are all three shots behind the leader at 5-under.
Defending champion Mark O'Meara struggled to a 2-over 74.
Tiger Woods, making his second professional appearance, is 2-under 70 after the first round.
The par-72 Glen Abbey Golf Club course measures 7,112 yards. First prize is $270,000.
